inversiones_max.name: René Foreest Minaya Isidro
inversiones_max.content: We highlight the professionalism, commitment and technical capacity of Arnie Calderón, who developed Ventify for our company. Since its implementation, we have managed to increase our sales by 97%, ensure order and control of our inventory, and greater efficiency in the knowledge and monitoring of our profit margins. We highly recommend Arnie and his Ventify system as a reliable, innovative and effective strategic ally.

about.title: About Me
about.intro: I'm a passionate full-stack developer focused on creating modern and efficient web applications.
about.name: Arnie Calderon
about.bio_paragraph1: Hi! I'm Arnie, a proactive and self-taught full-stack web developer, currently in the 7th semester of Software Engineering. I'm passionate about creating efficient, functional, and user-centered web solutions.
about.bio_paragraph2: With solid mastery of front-end technologies like React and back-end like Node.js and Python, I enjoy the challenge of continuous learning and improvement. My journey in development is demonstrated through innovative personal projects you can see in this portfolio.
about.bio_paragraph3: What drives me is transforming complex ideas into intuitive applications that solve real problems. My goal is to contribute to challenging projects where I can apply my passion for clean code, best practices, and continuous learning. I'm characterized by my quick adaptability, results-oriented approach, and commitment to technical excellence.

ventify.title: Ventify
ventify.description: Complete POS and inventory management system for businesses with multiple branches. Features real-time sales tracking, order reservations, custom orders, cash register control, granular user permissions, transaction reports, and more.
ventify.long_description:
Ventify is a comprehensive Point of Sale (POS) and inventory management system developed for businesses with multiple branches. It enables complete management of products, real-time sales, order reservations, custom orders, cash register control, users with granular permissions, transaction reports, and more. It's designed to optimize business operations with mixed payment integration, warehouse management, and low stock alerts.

Main Features:
- Multi-Branch Management: Complete control of multiple business locations
- Real-Time Sales: Live sales tracking and inventory updates
- Order Reservations: Advanced reservation system for products
- Custom Orders: Personalized order creation and management
- Cash Register Control: Complete cash flow and transaction management
- Granular Permissions: Role-based access control system
- Transaction Reports: Detailed analytics and business intelligence
- Mixed Payments: Support for multiple payment methods
- Warehouse Management: Multi-location inventory control
- Low Stock Alerts: Automatic notifications for inventory management

Technologies Used:
- Frontend: Next.js 14 (React with App Router), TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, Shadcn/ui for UI components
- Backend & Database: Firebase (Firestore for real-time data, Authentication for users, Storage for files, Hosting for deployment)
- Other Libraries: date-fns for date handling, lucide-react for icons, react-hook-form for forms, and custom services for inventory management, reservations, and payments
- Deployment: Firebase Hosting, with SSR/SSG support and production optimization

This project stands out for its scalable architecture, real-time state management, and focus on commercial environment UX. It was developed as a SaaS solution for multiple accounts and branches.

features.cash_control: Complete cash register and transaction control

challenges.realtime_sync: Real-time data synchronization across multiple branches
challenges.complex_permissions: Implementation of complex granular permission system
challenges.concurrent_access: Handling concurrent user access and data consistency
challenges.scalability: Designing scalable architecture for growing businesses
challenges.offline_support: Implementing offline functionality for POS operations
challenges.performance: Optimizing performance with large datasets and real-time updates

ticket_world.title: Ticket World
ticket_world.description: Web platform for event ticket sales. Includes user roles (admin, provider, client), metrics dashboard, Google Maps integration and simulated payment system.
ticket_world.long_description:
Ticket World is a complete e-commerce platform specialized in event ticket sales. The project includes a robust user role system that allows different access levels and functionalities.

Main Features:
- Role System: Admin, Provider and Client with specific permissions
- Metrics Dashboard: Interactive dashboard with real-time statistics
- Google Maps Integration: Event location visualization
- Payment System: Payment gateway simulation
- Event Management: Complete CRUD of events and categories
- Shopping Cart: Multi-item purchase system

Technologies Used:
- Backend: Django + Django REST Framework
- Database: PostgreSQL
- Frontend: JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3
- APIs: Google Maps API

challenges.roles: Implementation of a robust role system

sumaq_uywa.title: Sumaq Uywa
sumaq_uywa.description: Application for farm administration, with dashboard and management modules for reproduction, health, feeding, sales and expenses. Includes a notification system to optimize production.
sumaq_uywa.long_description:
Sumaq Uywa is a comprehensive farm management application, designed specifically to optimize the administration of reproduction, health, feeding, sales and expenses of farm animals.

Main Features:
- Interactive Dashboard: Key farm metrics visualization
- Reproduction Management: Reproductive cycles and genealogy control
- Health Module: Medical and veterinary tracking
- Feeding Control: Diet and consumption records
- Sales Management: Complete sales and customer system
- Expense Control: Detailed operational cost tracking
- Notification System: Automatic alerts for important events

Technologies Used:
- Frontend: React + TypeScript
- Backend: Node.js + Express
- Database: PostgreSQL
- Styles: Tailwind CSS
- State: React Context + Hooks

challenges.performance: Performance optimization with large data volumes

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Find answers to the most common questions. If you don't find what you're looking for, don't hesitate to contact me.

tech_stack.question: What technologies do you use in your projects?
tech_stack.answer: I mainly work with modern technologies from the JavaScript/TypeScript ecosystem like Next.js, React, Node.js, and databases like PostgreSQL and MongoDB. I also use development tools like Git, Docker, and cloud services like Vercel and AWS.

project_duration.question: How long does a typical project take?
project_duration.answer: Development time varies depending on project complexity. A basic website can take 2-4 weeks, while more complex web applications may require 2-3 months or more. I always provide detailed estimates after the initial consultation.

support.question: Do you offer support and maintenance after delivery?
support.answer: Yes, I offer different support and maintenance plans that include security updates, bug fixes, and small improvements. I'm also available for long-term expansion projects.

freelance.question: Do you accept freelance projects?
freelance.answer: Yes, I'm open to interesting freelance projects. I prefer working on projects that use modern technologies and present interesting technical challenges. Contact me with your project details.

remote_work.question: Do you work with remote teams?
remote_work.answer: Absolutely. I have experience working with globally distributed teams. I'm familiar with agile methodologies, collaboration tools like Slack, Jira, and Git, and I easily adapt to different time zones.

code_review.question: Can I see your code before hiring you?
code_review.answer: Yes, you have access to my GitHub where you can review open source projects and code examples. I can also share specific examples of work similar to your project (respecting confidentiality agreements).

full_service.question: What does a complete web development project include?
full_service.answer: A complete project includes: requirements analysis, architecture design, frontend and backend development, database integration, API implementation, testing, deployment, documentation, and basic training for system usage.

uiux_design.question: Do you offer UI/UX design services?
uiux_design.answer: Although I'm not a graphic designer, I have experience implementing designs and can work with existing mockups. For projects requiring design from scratch, I can recommend designers I regularly collaborate with.

migrations.question: Do you handle migrations of existing sites?
migrations.answer: Yes, I have experience migrating sites from legacy platforms to modern technologies. This includes data migration, functionality reimplementation, performance improvement, and ensuring seamless transition.

nextjs_vs_react.question: Why Next.js instead of pure React?
nextjs_vs_react.answer: Next.js offers significant advantages over pure React: Server-Side Rendering for better SEO, file-based routing, automatic image optimization, built-in API routes, and better out-of-the-box performance. It's ideal for most modern web applications.

testing_strategy.question: What testing strategy do you use?
testing_strategy.answer: I implement testing at multiple levels: unit tests with Jest and React Testing Library, integration tests, E2E tests with Playwright, and continuous integration with GitHub Actions. The goal is to have at least 70% code coverage.

scalability.question: How do you handle scalability?
scalability.answer: I design applications thinking about scalability from the start: modular architecture, CDN usage, strategic caching, database optimization, lazy loading, and preparation for cloud services like Vercel Edge Functions or AWS Lambda.

security.question: Do you implement security measures?
security.answer: Security is a priority. I implement: secure authentication (JWT, OAuth), CSRF protection, input sanitization, security headers, HTTPS, rate limiting, and follow OWASP best practices. I also perform regular security audits.

workflow.question: What is your work process?
workflow.answer: I follow a structured process: 1) Initial consultation and requirements analysis, 2) Proposal and budget, 3) Architecture design and planning, 4) Iterative development with regular demos, 5) Comprehensive testing, 6) Deployment and documentation, 7) Post-launch support.

updates.question: Do you provide updates during development?
updates.answer: Yes, I maintain constant communication. I use Agile methodology with 1-2 week sprints, regular demos, and access to a staging environment where you can review progress in real-time. I also use project management tools for total transparency.

satisfaction.question: What happens if you're not satisfied with the result?
satisfaction.answer: I work iteratively with constant feedback to avoid surprises. I include reviews at each project phase. If there are aspects that don't meet expectations, I adjust them until achieving your satisfaction, always within the agreed scope.

faq.cta_description: I'm here to help you. Send me a message with your question.
